adjective.description: Able to move quickly and easily.
examples: Ruth was as agile as a monkey

adjective.description: Relating to or denoting a method of project management, used especially for software development, that is characterized by the division of tasks into short phases of work and frequent reassessment and adaptation of plans.
examples: agile methods replace high-level design with frequent redesign

origin: Late Middle English: via French from Latin agilis, from agere do.
